SEARCH
Package edu.core.billingmanagement

Class Billing

java.lang.Object
edu.core.billingmanagement.Billing
public class Billing extends Object
Represents the billing information associated with a reservation. This class provides methods to manage, dispute, and adjust the bill, as well as generate a receipt for a successful payment.

  • Constructor Summary

    • Billing

      public Billing(Reservation reservation, double totalAmount, String receipt)
      Constructs a new Billing object with the given reservation details, total amount, and receipt.
      Parameters:
      reservation - The reservation associated with this bill.
      totalAmount - The total amount to be billed.
      receipt - The receipt for the bill.

  • Method Details

    • getTotalAmount

      public double getTotalAmount()
      Gets the total amount to be billed.
      Returns:
      The total billing amount.

    • disputeCharge

      public void disputeCharge(String reason)
      Marks the current bill as disputed.

    • isDisputed

      public boolean isDisputed()
      Checks if the current bill has been disputed.
      Returns:
      True if the bill is disputed, otherwise false.

    • adjustAmount

      public void adjustAmount(double newAmount)
      Allows adjusting the total billing amount.
      Parameters:
      newAmount - The new amount to be billed.

    • generateReceipt

      public String generateReceipt()
      Generates and returns a receipt for a successful payment. The receipt includes details such as the reservation ID and total amount paid.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the digital receipt.

    • resolveDispute

      public void resolveDispute(String resolutionNotes)
      Resolves the current dispute associated with this bill.
      Parameters:
      resolutionNotes - Notes or comments detailing the resolution of the dispute.

    • isDisputeResolved

      public boolean isDisputeResolved()
      Checks if the dispute associated with this bill has been resolved.
      Returns:
      True if the dispute has been resolved, otherwise false.
